instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on internal LCD
threads.message:
Hi there!

No water damage.
Image on external monitor but not on internal LCD. Tested with good new LCD - same.
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> - 0.9V
L9000 - 0.27V

PLease advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on internal LCD
threads.message: Check when powering on if there is a pulse of 5V on L9000. Inspect for damaged caps/coils in the DP lines to the connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on internal LCD
threads.message: Pulsates from 0 to 0.27V then to 0V and 0.27V a few times on boot. Inspected DP lines everything looks in order. Did an ultrasonic clean, same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on internal LCD
threads.message: <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> coming high while turning it on, it will also be a pulse, so monitor while powering on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on internal LCD
threads.message: No pulse on <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>. Tried with a new working LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image on internal LCD
threads.message: See if it is shorted to GND. Any history on this, this usually does not "just" happen.
